trans-unit.source: Describes a string of characters.
Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> structure.
An unmanaged pointer reference to a character string.
The number of characters in <c>unsafecharacterString</c> to use.
Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> structure from a unmanaged character string.
The caller needs unmanaged code permission in order to invoke the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.%23ctor%2A> method.
trans-unit.target: Der Aufrufer benötigt die Berechtigung für nicht verwalteten Code zum Aufrufen der <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.%23ctor%2A> Methode.

trans-unit.source: The character array.
The character buffer offset to the first character.
The number of characters in <c>characterArray</c> to use.
Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> structure from a character array.
The character string.
The character buffer offset to the first character.
The number of characters in <c>characterString</c> to use.
Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> structure from a character string.
Gets a reference to the character buffer of a string.
A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference" /> value representing the character buffer of a string.
trans-unit.target: Ein <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferReference" /> Wert, der der Zeichenpuffer einer Zeichenfolge darstellt.

trans-unit.source: Gets an empty character string.
A <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object whose <see cref="P:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.Length" /> is equal to 0.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object.
The <see cref="T:System.Object" /> to compare with the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object.
Determines whether the specified object is equal to the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object.
<see langword="true" /> if <paramref name="o" /> is equal to the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
If <paramref name="o" /> is not a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object, <see langword="false" /> is returned.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange> objects are equal if the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.CharacterBufferReference%2A> properties are equal.
trans-unit.target: Zwei <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange> -Objekte sind gleich, wenn die <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.CharacterBufferReference%2A> Eigenschaften gleich sind.

trans-unit.source: The <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> to compare with the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object.

Determines whether the <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object is equal to the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object.
<see langword="true" /> if <paramref name="value" /> is equal to the current <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
If <paramref name="value" /> is not a <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> object, <see langword="false" /> is returned.

Two <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange> objects are equal if the <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.CharacterBufferReference%2A> properties are equal.
trans-unit.target: Zwei <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange> -Objekte sind gleich, wenn die <xref:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange.CharacterBufferReference%2A> Eigenschaften gleich sind.

trans-unit.source: Serves as a hash function for <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" />.
It is suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures such as a hash table.
An <see cref="T:System.Int32" /> value that represents the hash code for the current object.
Gets the number of characters in the text source character store.
An <see cref="T:System.Int32" /> value that represents the total number of characters.
trans-unit.target: Ein <see cref="T:System.Int32" /> Wert, der die Gesamtzahl der Zeichen darstellt.

trans-unit.source: The first instance of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> to compare.
The second instance of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> to compare.
Compare two <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> strings for equality.
<see langword="true" /> to show the specified <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> objects are equal; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
The first instance of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> to compare.
The second instance of <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> to compare.
Compare two <see cref="T:System.Windows.Media.TextFormatting.CharacterBufferRange" /> strings for inequality.
<see langword="false" /> to show <paramref name="left" /> is equal to <paramref name="right" />; otherwise, <see langword="true" />.
